result.execSummary:
The defendant Orion Mikal Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Orion Mikal Allen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Orion Mikal Allen was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA and comply with any recommendations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Orion Mikal Allen in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendnat pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in  14 CM 713 and Ct. 1 in 15 CM 175, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 in 14 CM 713 and Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 in 15 CM 175 dismissed, 14 CM 713, Ct. 1 and 15 CM 175, Ct. 1, Court withholds sentence,  probatoin 2 years, 14 CM 713, Ct. 1, AODA and comply, $443.00 costs, 15 CM 175, Ct. 1, AODA and comply, $443.00 costs, Defendant to submit DNA Sample,

Cases called: 14CM713 & 15CM175,  Defendant Orion Mikal Allen in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return date scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
